Posts.Content: sascha rose that's awful! and the person who was talking prob knew nothing about cancer in general but that doesnt help! my favourite so far is a work colleague who has constantly annoyed me even before diagnosis, said just think you'll be able to buy a whole new wardrobe after 'all this'........me, pardon?.......well you'll lose loads of weight wont u?!! i did turn round and say i couldnt give a crap if im really fat or stick thin im just wanting to be alive! she's also asked me what im going to do after 'all this' is over? (am guessing she means will i have a party or something!) i suppose on a plus point she sees me beating it! im signed off work at the mo for my op and general sanity as people just keep asking me how i am and ive started to find it wearing, the people who i am closer to just joke about which is fine, i have a fairly flat chested friend who said its not too bad you'll get used to it :) in ref to my now smaller, well non existant cup size! but that was said in nice way, and is my sense of humour. i find people draining in general at the mo but guess its cos it reminds me im not them anymore and im on a side road at the moment hoping for a turning back onto the main street. cancer brings the analogies (spelt wrong!) out in me!! x
Posts.Title: so annoyed with crass comments

Posts.Content: sorry just remembered another harsher one, mail nurse on my second night post masectomy in hospital, telling me he sees alot of younger people with cancer now, then how his mum died of breast cancer, yet more death references then he said i always wonder what im going to die of.................so basically its 11pm and im now thinking he knows im about to die and this is it for me. was so pleased i had an audio book of something to take mind away from the shit feeling he left me with. x
Posts.Title: so annoyed with crass comments

Posts.Content: hi my husband is in similar situation as i have been to work when i can (ie not at the hospital!) and im newly diagnosed and get the full results tomorrow after my lumpectomy on aug 22nd. his mum had breast cancer 4 years ago and he has said because her overall experience was positive and shes doing ok that he isnt as freaked out as he would be. i find that as long as he lets me talk about it when i want and get worried or hideaway when i need too then thats all i need from him. im fine to hear how he feels because he doesnt say it in a way that makes me feel im at fault! i think in the early days just functioning and dealing with the practical is a way of letting the information slowly enter our minds cos if u think tooo much all the different outcomes and challenges are overwhelming! i knew once i had surgery i would crash so i also spent time from initial diagnosis organising work and even cancelled the window cleaner! to save money and after surgery i basically did nothing for 5 days as felt very low but husband was great making me meals, hoovering and looking after our 20 month old daughter who unfortunately was the illest shes ever been!!! i think its nice to know u r worried but also feel positive about the outcome and also just let her know however she feels or acts or whatever surgery she has done it doesnt affect you as a couple and u will support her till she is well again.
Posts.Title: Hi

Posts.Content: hi, im not in same situation really but im about to have a single mastectomy with delayed reconstruction, ive just had a lumpectomy and they need more from me so its best it just all goes, ive decided to have it now and look at my post treatment reconstruction as a 'treat', sort of get hair back and get boob back type thing, i wont have recon tilll after radiotherapy, im a bit concerned my clothes wont hang right and ill feel odd in general but after my results today i met a lady who works at my old work place who had mx 8 years ago and never had recon and untill she lifted her top i wouldnt have had a clue! she had a special bra that had a prosethetic inside it and shes happy as she is (im still planning recon at the moment) further time off work is an issue but will u be building holiday up while you are off sick? (not sure if it works like that know it did when i was on maternity a few years back but thats a bit different!) if it does work like that u could use those holiday days for op? there's so much to take on board so its best to do it day by day and week by week (for me anyway), i am also finding when stuff happens i cope alot better than i think im going to! xxx
Posts.Title: Worried, told have to have delayed reconstruction

Posts.Content: thank you for all your replies, feeling better today and yesterday, got achey bone feeling last night which was annoying but im definately feeling happier! husband has even managed to fix washing machine to give me enough time to look for one i want! (he has mig welder in shed and luckily is fairly hands on when it comes to practical stuff!) i didnt fast before fec but i did limit what i ate and kept to clear liquids (water and aÂ  cup of green tea!) from night before, i think not eating big meals did help and may cut back a bit further for next one, im definately not underweight ;) my husbands work did a collection for me and i have some lovely chocs which i was glad to be able to enjoy a few of yesterday and am also enjoying my tea again! i was due my period at start of fec and im wondering if this made it a bit worse as im usually wiped for 1 day from that. picc line is feeling more comfortable now which im pleased about even with a swift kick it just received from a tantrumming toddler! i have an injection day after for bone marrow too and my temp went up briefly after i had it but not by too much. diary is a good idea and have done one in retrospect so can remember what happened when i go for next one. on a plus side i have wig fitting tomorrow and apparently my prothesis has arrived but ive decided i dont want an extra hospital trip so will collect with next chem, my m and s t shirt bra with comfy looks fine for now. next hurdle is baldness.................only part of me looking forward to that is the one sick of washing my hair but its all part of the purge and will come back. xxx
Posts.Title: 1st fec

Posts.Content: hi all, had first fec on tuesday and have mainly been wiped! and very very emotional, cant see light at all but am trying best i can. i havent been sick which i'm glad of but have had the shakey tired feeling u get after a really bad tummy bug. i just want to check whats normal as i have no idea anymore! i have had dexamathasone and ondansatron to take at home i also had the stronger one and hour before chemo and 1 a day for 2 days after cant remember name, emend or something. last dexamethosone this morning, i have a fairly tight chest on and off and a pain in my lower left lung below my masectomy which i think started round same time as surgery, are these just treatment pains, ill metion them at next apt but right now i havent the strength. feel like ive let everyone down by being ill (even tho i know its not my fault it doesnt help) my daughter isnt even 2 yet, she will be in dec, 2 days before fec 3! im so scared ill leave her that i can barely look at her again. i took 6 years for me to get pregnant and now just as i thought i finally had everything i ever wanted this s**t happens. my husband is very confident it'll all be fine, his mum had triple negative breast cancer over 4 years ago and is fine and well, but i just cant seem to find any point in doing anything! the washing machine even broke this morning just to add to my hassle so ill have to drag myself out later to get one which is decent yet not complicated! sorry im going on! also ive a picc line fitted and was wondering did anyone else get the odd sensation bending your arm or getting stiff after sleep? do the drugs make u feel low? like after surgery? just want to stamp my feet and slam some doors and scream its not fair! but im too tired!! :) weak smile! sent husband to work today as little one in nursery and its been nice having quiet but i needed to come on here and just let it out a bit! thanks for reading xxx
Posts.Title: 1st fec

Posts.Content: just wanted to say u know u are protected about time off work dont you? (you probably do) so dont let work stress u. we are protected by the equality act 2010 so if u feel u r being discriminated against then u r protected. xxx
Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

Posts.Content: just wanted to say u know u are protected about time off work dont you? (you probably do) so dont let work stress u. we are protected by the equality act 2010 so if u feel u r being discriminated against then u r protected. xxx
Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

Posts.Content: that sums it up perfectly! ive been trying to explain how i am and you saying that, (i still cant articulate it!)Â  sums it it up! people keep saying im strong blah blah blah, but to me i just deal as i go if i want to cry, i cry, if i want to stay in bed and i can, i do, and if i feel up to going out, i go! i wont make myself try and feel something i dont cos its pointless and will always make u feel worse! its the same as grieving a loved one some days u are completely winded and cant cope and others u feel fine and lots of other imbetween feelings, just go with the moments and enjoy the good ones and ride out the bad untill a good one pops by! i also agree stress is bad, not just for cancer but everything! and for the first time in my life i think i finally no longer care what people think of me, have even been out today braless and i only have 1 boob, admittedly im still on painkillers so my usual senses are elsewhere! i have always worried if im doing something right, even bringing up my daughter but now i can see how i am or feel is right not what others say i should do! ive just jibbered on a bit! but i read that and just thought yes!!! xxx
Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

Posts.Content: that sums it up perfectly! ive been trying to explain how i am and you saying that, (i still cant articulate it!)Â  sums it it up! people keep saying im strong blah blah blah, but to me i just deal as i go if i want to cry, i cry, if i want to stay in bed and i can, i do, and if i feel up to going out, i go! i wont make myself try and feel something i dont cos its pointless and will always make u feel worse! its the same as grieving a loved one some days u are completely winded and cant cope and others u feel fine and lots of other imbetween feelings, just go with the moments and enjoy the good ones and ride out the bad untill a good one pops by! i also agree stress is bad, not just for cancer but everything! and for the first time in my life i think i finally no longer care what people think of me, have even been out today braless and i only have 1 boob, admittedly im still on painkillers so my usual senses are elsewhere! i have always worried if im doing something right, even bringing up my daughter but now i can see how i am or feel is right not what others say i should do! ive just jibbered on a bit! but i read that and just thought yes!!! xxx
Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

Posts.Content: my 1st tax is 2 days before my birthday! joy eh? (ill be 36 then, that seems so much older in writing!) im also hoping i prefer tax, i probably wont but at least it is past half way and at the moment the unknown is better than experiencing it! thank you for all your replies. xx
Posts.Title: what delays chemo?

Posts.Content: my chemo is delayed :( till tuesday, am gutted. but as long as my bloods are ok monday (neutropenic) then tuesday ill be good to go and i think i should just about get tasteboods for christmas but guessing i may have heart burn. i could always celebrate a day lat ei guess but im a stubborn so n so! i havent got a raised temp, but i do ache and feel cold and tired alot so plan for tomorrow is take little one to nursery (at 11) come home eat lunch and go to bed!! and either listen to a book or just sleep but i must do my best to get strength and blood back up. xx
Posts.Title: what delays chemo?

Posts.Content: i have my 3rd fec on thursday (i really dont want to go!!! as in small child dragging heals having tantrum!) i feel like i have a cold, sore eyes, bit achey, very tired but dont have a temperature. even tho i hate it, i dont want it delayed as currently i get christmas and this is my favourite time of year, i have ordered the food and planned the day (quiet one with husband and daughter). i was wondering what would delay chemo. really really not looking forward to feeling sick again but it is last fec at least, do u get nausea on tax? im not looking forward to tax but am pleased to have a change! xxx
Posts.Title: what delays chemo?

Posts.Content: Thanks Lola, i think its a bit sad im looking forward to pain instead of sickness and i also know that ill be regretting that sentence and thought at some point!! :) xx
Posts.Title: what delays chemo?

Posts.Content: im confused. im 2 days past 2nd chemo so im not fully with it and this thread has confused me. are we saying screening may detect more than nescessary, is it dcis that is mainly reffered to? what does this mean in relation to my treatment? im 35 and found a lump and then got refferered to breats clinice, had ultra sound, mammo and biopsy and was diagnosed with 2cm lump invasive breast cancer, now i desperately want to see my almost 2 year old girl grow up but all theses post seem to indicate im going to die soon of either cancer or the treatment im now receiveing. like i say its confused me and as i am low and feel rather poorly anyway i cant seem to interpret it as i usually might. is it a certain age group, type of cancer, type of pre cancer. what is being over diagnosed? i was given options through out and could of refused chemo but i feel not able to take that risk as id never forgive myself if i was someone it would save. i also chose mx when they found high grade dcis even tho i was offered further wle. hope what ive put made some sense.
Posts.Title: screening mammography

Posts.Content: hi all i have a masectomy on wednesday, slightly short notice cos i managed to get in on a cancellation. i was wondering should i get a masectomy bra yet, i have lots of none under wired bras from maternity and breast feeding so wondered if theyd be ok initially. also wondered will i be staying in over night as i did for my lumpectomy but i have a standard letter from hospital for day surgery. and my main concern is how long did everyones drains stay in?!!! i dont like them and my ones from a few weeks back were basically in overnight and nothing really drained so were removed. and another question (sorry!) has anyone else had lymph nodes removed on an initial op (1 in 6 was positive) and then had a few more removed after that (just to check!) also as im a tad squeamish, mainly when i can feel the discomfort/pain so will be fine (i hope) when i heal, how long was it before u looked at the space the boob used to be and how did u feel? answers to any of those questions would be gratefully received! xxx
Posts.Title: impending masectomy

Posts.Content: hi everyone, i thought id post my recent experience just to add to everyones masectomy experiences cos its useful for people to have an overview. i went in wed morn and ended up being 1st one in! when i came round i had whats called a 'bair hugger' over me which is a bit like a lilo and is constantantly filled with warm air which is to aid healing and for me as a side effect it worked like a hot water bottle on period pains and eased the pain of the surgery, i havent had reconstruction, and apparently they like it on for 48 hours if u have and he wanted me to have it for 24 hours unfortunately i developed a haemotoma (this doesnt happen to everyone and most people are fine) which the surgeon saw before he went home wed eve (luckily) so he bandaged me up with lots of pressure to help it disperse and took bair hugger off me but i was nil by mouth till the morning ward round 'just incase'. am pleased to say his bandage worked and i was fine, i think cos was my second op in 3 weeks i was a bit weakened and they fitted me with a catheter just for 1 day (i didnt want longer and they didnt want me to either!) so i could rest as i had difficulty sitting up or moving, then the next day i woke up fine! could move really well and after catheter was out i got dressed and went for half a shower on my own drains in one hand and a one handed difficult wash with the other! came home yesterday with 1 drain which i had taken out this morning after popping back up to the hospital i havent looked at wound yet as im not ready but i feel better than last op because i already have some of my results. the worst part of whole think was a male nurse who talked to me about death on the second night at about 11pm which really got my panicy and upset and luckily i had audio books with me so put one on and concentrated on that! i know this is prob disjointed as mind is that way in general these days! xxx
Posts.Title: impending masectomy

Posts.Content: thank you for all your replies they've really helped. and its nice to hear a few different experiences as it 'normalises' it in my head and i dont feel so seperate from the rest of the population. i read them on sat night but have only managed to get to the laptop today! (doesnt seem to let me do replies on phone, no idea why) i keep hearing the term cording, what is it? i've had 6 nodes out and wondered what it was. i still have discomfort in arm pit and skin just feels tender on arm (no weher near the scars!) and as im back in wed i get to start again!! xxx
Posts.Title: impending masectomy

Posts.Content: i prefer you're attitude to mine!!! im seriously crap with surgery and the afterwards, my poor hubby gets to be nurse as i wont look but im asking him to describe it! im going to try and be bit braver this time but know i probably wont look till i get home! i would prefer a one night stay as i have a toddler and ill be safer in hospital! :) xxx
Posts.Title: impending masectomy

Posts.Content: hi highland mum, same here regarding lymph node, had 6 out at lumpecomy but cos i have dcis in margins am now having mx and they are taking that oppurtunity to check a few more nodes, just hope they come back clear! i vary between im doing this all for someone else to omg its actually me, i feel a bit more like i have cancer now im having a mx, cos i still have most of my boob from previous op so feels normal ish but after wed there will be a gap! hope your results are clear xxx
Posts.Title: impending masectomy

Posts.Content: thanks yvonne, i had my lumpectomy 3 weeks ago and will be exactly 4 weeks on day of masectomy! cos they had to remove my nipple at that time ive had trouble looking at me now and am at a stage where 6/10 times i'm fairly ok but if i look when tired or low then the tears start. if your pain was managable with all that then thats reassured me (sorry)Â  with this as i wondered if pain would be more as following on from previous surgery, ive got dcis in theÂ  affected breast, i also had invasive but they said the lumpectomy has taken that away, i could have just had a bit more removed but i may have still had to have a mx, also if i did only have a bit taken i would always be wondering if there had been a bit more further back! will have a look at m&s bras, had forgotten its zero vat. think its a good idea to make yourself look, thats what i plan to do.............in a few weeks time anyway! was going to start now but im now preparing for it to go so no point in getting used to it, shame i'd already nickname it arfur! ('half a' boob!) i dont want to come home with drains for probably a bit of an odd reason which is i'd have to sleep on the 'wrong' side of the bed! good advice about the comfy, i wonder if they will let me have 2! xxx
Posts.Title: impending masectomy

Posts.Content: welcome eggshell, everyone on here have been brilliant and if they can help they will! its the first forum ive ever been on for anything, but it is good hearing from people that get how u feel rather than just think they do!!!!! good luck for wed, its sort of comforting knowing someone else is having same op! u dont live in devon do u?! i cant post on phone so i'll post when out and up to it! xxx
Posts.Title: impending masectomy

Posts.Content: thank you sascha, this really helped but unfortunately i can read but not post from phone (no idea why!) everytime i looked it up it confused me but this is nice and straught forward and my curious mind feels satisfied. xx
Posts.Title: what;s ki 67?

Posts.Content: hi i looked at the nhs predict tool and ki67 is listed (pos, neg, unknown) and i just wondered what it is! scared to asked BCN yet just incase it makes me worry! just wondering what it is! as i know my er status and her2, not sure if this is new! thanks
Posts.Title: what;s ki 67?

Posts.Content: hi, i had a seroma after my masectomy and didnt get it drained but i did get it checked everytime i thought it got worse. It did go on its own, slowly! i cant remember how long but it must of been about a month. the advise i got was same as you, we wont drain unless necessary due to risk of infection, also it doesnt always work. They told me if it was uncomfortable and i could cope they would leave it, however they also said if it looked like my breast had grown back they would drain it. i think mine only got as big as half a boob, and i 'adjusted' my softie by removing most of its filling :) xx
Posts.Title: Seroma after mastectomy
